answers.answer: I would suggest going to your doctor to get that all squared away.  Just to be on the safe side.  Good luck and I hope you get what you want!!
When was the last time that you tested?A HPT test is reasonably accurate about 2 weeks after conception. You would not be 6 months pregnant unless you hadnt tested in 5.5 months.

the last time i tested was in january,
the last time i tested was january,

If you were pregnant, you would not be very far along.I would suggest you visit the doctor to find out what is going on.   If you arent pregnant ( your doctor can run blood work to determine this) and are urinating more frequently this is something that needs to be looked into - a UTI, diabetes, stress, hormonal imbalance are all things that could cause frequent urination.

It is completely normal to have a period that lasts 2 days long (in fact, mine usually last 2-3 days). That doesn't mean you're pregnant nor does it have to do with pregnancy.However, if you are missing periods, that's another story. How long are your cycles (the time between each period)? If you're irregular then it'll be difficult to know when your next period is due.A pregnancy test is most accurate after you miss a period.

question: Hi,I have taken pregnancy tests over the last few months all of which have come back negative. I finally relaxed and stopped worry about it and thought if it happens it happens.  However the reason i have taken the tests is because my periods changed 6months ago and I went from having a 5-6day period to a 2day long period. This is still happening so when i realised that i'm needing to go to the toilet alot more frequently i started to wonder...however these two things on top  the fact that i think i may have pile like things and my breasts are very sensitive and i have white spots on my nipples....is this a phantom pregnancy or is this not a coincidence and i'm actually expecting!? Please help me!!
title: Sounds silly but am i expecting?
